title: Ube cafe closed twice by Somerville officials over licensing
author: Katelyn Umholtz
bullets: Food News The owners of Kula Jay's Ube Kafe claim the city has issued confusing and changing orders since they tried to open their doors in mid-November.
An ube drink from Kula Jay's Ube Kafe.

title: Tell us: What was your top live entertainment event of 2025?
author: Peter Chianca
bullets: Tell Us We want to know what local concert, comedy show, or theater experience stands out from the last year.
Lorde, “Harry Potter and the Cursed Child,” Stevie Nicks, Renee Rapp, Kendrick Lamar, and Sarah Sherman were all live entertainment highlights in Greater Boston this year.
Courtesy photo; Matthew Murphy; Ben Stas for The Boston Globe; Kelly Chan/Boston.

title: Nursing assistant accused of sexually assaulting child at N.H. hospital
author: Madison Lucchesi
bullets: Crime The child was being treated at the hospital, according to police.
ShareSend this article to your social connections.
A nursing assistant has been charged for allegedly sexually assaulting a child being treated at the New Hampshire hospital where he works.

title: NBA analysts intrigued by Celtics’ odds to win the East, Jayson Tatum return ‘more interesting by the day’

bullets: Morning Sports Update "That is not anything I would've remotely entertained two months ago.

title: Police arrest suspect who allegedly pushed woman onto tracks at North Station
author: Madison Lucchesi
bullets: Crime The incident occurred on Thursday afternoon.
A woman has been arrested for an alleged assault and battery incident at North Station on Thursday, according to MBTA Transit Police.
The woman allegedly pushed another woman onto the Green Line tracks in an “unprovoked” attack, The Boston Globe reported.

title: Boston man convicted in ‘vicious’ attack on homeless woman
author: Madison Lucchesi
bullets: Crime Anthony Dew, 43, was sentenced to seven-and-a-half years to nine years and will be retried for additional charges in January.
A Dorchester man was sentenced to up to nine years in prison on Monday for a 2024 “vicious” attack on a homeless woman.

Anthony Dew, 43, was sentenced to seven-and-a-half years to nine years in state prison for the charges of assault and battery and assault and battery causing serious bodily injury and strangulation, according to the Suffolk County District Attorney’s Office.

title: WBZ files motion to dismiss most of Kate Merrill’s discrimination lawsuit
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Local News The motion argues filing the complaint against Merrill, investigating that complaint, and announcing her demotion weren’t driven by actual malice.
